DOC.brief_summary: Previous reports have the evidence implicating gait velocity may affect kinematic parameters. However, how the gait velocity will influence kinematic parameters remain unclear. The purpose of this research is to find out kinematic characteristics among different gait velocity. To do this, it will provide a reference for future prospective studies or investigations and make us fully understand the impact of gait velocity.
DOC.brief_title: The Relationship Between Gait Velocity and Gait Parameters
DOC.criteria: 1. 20< age < 30. 2. Body mass index < 30. 3. No history of major injury or surgery in lower limbs. 4. No symptoms of lower limbs. 5. Physical examination to test the lower limbs to be normal. 6. The habit of moderate exercise (e.g. Jogging) at least once a week for at least 30 minutes. 1. Body mass index >30. 2. Injury or surgery in hip/knee/ankle. 3. History trauma in the lower limbs (e.g. fracture). 4. Neuropathic disease. 5. Muscular disease. 6. Lack ability to finish the procedure physically or mentally. 7. Easy to fall. 8. Any other conditions that can influence gait parameters of the lower limbs.
